meanings.sent1: The morning was foggy, making it hard to see far ahead.
meanings.sent2: The view from the hill was foggy, with mist covering the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The foggy mirror after a hot shower made him look like a ghost.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was foggy, like trying to recall a dream.
meanings.sent5: The forest was so foggy that it felt like walking through a cloud.

meanings.sent1: His memory of the accident was foggy, unable to recall details clearly.
meanings.sent2: The future seemed foggy, uncertain and unclear.
meanings.sent3: The foggy explanation left everyone more confused than before.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was foggy with sleep, struggling to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was so foggy, it was hard to make out the faces.

meanings.sent1: His instructions were foggy, leaving us unsure of what to do next.
meanings.sent2: The meeting agenda was foggy, lacking clear objectives.
meanings.sent3: The foggy directions led us in circles, unable to find the right path.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was foggy with conflicting emotions, unable to make a decision.
meanings.sent5: The explanation was so foggy that it only added to the confusion.
